results.title: The Great cod fisher woman
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Ramptha Edwards and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ramptha Edwards tells the story of her mother, a strong Yorta-Yorta woman who provided for her family, even if that involved moving away to work. Her skills as a fisherwoman were well known and Edwards understands that its cod that connects her to her mother’s spirit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Ramptha Edwards and ACMI
results.description: Ramptha Edwards tells the story of her mother, a strong Yorta-Yorta woman who provided for her family, even if that involved moving away to work. Her skills as a fisherwoman were well known and Edwards understands that its cod that connects her to her mother’s spirit.
description_for_label: Ramptha Edwards tells the story of her mother, a strong Yorta-Yorta woman who provided for her family, even if that involved moving away to work. Her skills as a fisherwoman were well known and Edwards understands that its cod that connects her to her mother’s spirit.

results.title: Little Dolly : Shakira
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Daniel Edwards and ACMI
results.brief_description: Daniel Edwards’ little girl, Shakira, was born with Miller-Dieker syndrome, a congenital disorder. Edwards pays tribute to his late daughter, who he affectionately refers to as ‘Little Dolly’.

results.title: Goanna
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Anna Williams and ACMI
results.brief_description: Anna Williams’ story is ultimately about empowerment through music. Her uncle, Harry Williams, was a famous Indigenous country musician. Anna tells his story and how his influence and inspiration has helped to empower and heal Williams.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Anna Williams and ACMI

results.title: Art 4 Starts
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Sonya Waters and ACMI
results.brief_description: What other people consider vandalism or graffiti, Sonya Waters sees as street art. Behind the work, Waters recognises the skill and social commentary inherent in the work and seeks to help the artists, often kids from disadvantaged backgrounds, recognise the artistic and social value of their work and become empowered by it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Sonya Waters and ACMI
results.description: What other people consider vandalism or graffiti, Sonya Waters sees as street art. Behind the work, Waters recognises the skill and social commentary inherent in the work and seeks to help the artists, often kids from disadvantaged backgrounds, recognise the artistic and social value of their work and become empowered by it.
description_for_label: What other people consider vandalism or graffiti, Sonya Waters sees as street art. Behind the work, Waters recognises the skill and social commentary inherent in the work and seeks to help the artists, often kids from disadvantaged backgrounds, recognise the artistic and social value of their work and become empowered by it.

results.title: Unwise and foolish creations of fancy
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Sally McCutcheon and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sally McCutcheon tells her story, threaded together by her two life-long passions, dancing and beading. Through determination, discipline and the support of her family, McCutcheon has managed to excel at both at different stages of her life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Sally McCutcheon and ACMI
results.description: Sally McCutcheon tells her story, threaded together by her two life-long passions, dancing and beading. Through determination, discipline and the support of her family, McCutcheon has managed to excel at both at different stages of her life.

results.title: Princes Street Port Melbourne
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Lyn McLeavy and ACMI
results.brief_description: A tribute to a suburb, a family and a lady who liked to play the piano and sing the blues. Lyn McLeavey describes growing up in Port Melbourne in the 1950s, blending in the harsh realities of life as the daughter of a traumatised ‘wharfie’, with the simple joy of the sounds of the streets.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Lyn McLeavy and ACMI
results.description: A tribute to a suburb, a family and a lady who liked to play the piano and sing the blues. Lyn McLeavey describes growing up in Port Melbourne in the 1950s, blending in the harsh realities of life as the daughter of a traumatised ‘wharfie’, with the simple joy of the sounds of the streets.

results.title: Coming home
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Louise Blake and ACMI
results.brief_description: Despite being born in Canberra, Louise Blake’s family history has very strong ties to Melbourne. Over the years, family trips have drawn Blake ‘south of the border’, where suburbs like Port Melbourne and Brunswick evoke stories from her family history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Louise Blake and ACMI

results.title: Weeding wars in peaceful places
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Llywellyn Staiff and ACMI
results.brief_description: Flora, fauna and bushland is what makes Maroondah and Australia different to anywhere else in the world. The agenda of Llywellyn and her colleagues is to protect what’s left.
